verses.verse: At the end<WH7093> of every seven<WH7651> years<WH8141> thou shalt make<WH6213> a release<WH8059>.

And this is the manner<WH1697> of the release<WH8059>: Every creditor<WH1167> <WH4874> <WH3027> that lendeth<WH5383> ought unto his neighbour<WH7453> shall release<WH8058> it; he shall not exact<WH5065> it of his neighbour<WH7453>, or of his brother<WH251>; because it is called<WH7121> the LORD'S<WH3068> release<WH8059>. creditor: Heb. master of the lending of his hand
Of a foreigner<WH5237> thou mayest exact<WH5065> it again: but that which is thine with thy brother<WH251> thine hand<WH3027> shall release<WH8058>;

Save<WH657> when there shall be no poor<WH34> among you; for the LORD<WH3068> shall greatly<WH1288> bless<WH1288> thee in the land<WH776> which the LORD<WH3068> thy God<WH430> giveth<WH5414> thee for an inheritance<WH5159> to possess<WH3423> it: Save: or, To the end that there be no poor among you

Only if thou carefully<WH8085> hearken<WH8085> unto the voice<WH6963> of the LORD<WH3068> thy God<WH430>, to observe<WH8104> to do<WH6213> all these commandments<WH4687> which I command<WH6680> thee this day<WH3117>.

For the LORD<WH3068> thy God<WH430> blesseth<WH1288> thee, as he promised<WH1696> thee: and thou shalt lend<WH5670> unto many<WH7227> nations<WH1471>, but thou shalt not borrow<WH5670>; and thou shalt reign<WH4910> over many<WH7227> nations<WH1471>, but they shall not reign<WH4910> over thee.

If there be among you a poor man<WH34> of one<WH259> of thy brethren<WH251> within any<WH259> of thy gates<WH8179> in thy land<WH776> which the LORD<WH3068> thy God<WH430> giveth<WH5414> thee, thou shalt not harden<WH553> thine heart<WH3824>, nor shut<WH7092> thine hand<WH3027> from thy poor<WH34> brother<WH251>:
But thou shalt open<WH6605> thine hand<WH3027> wide<WH6605> unto him, and shalt surely<WH5670> lend<WH5670> him sufficient<WH1767> for his need<WH4270>, in that which he wanteth<WH2637>.

Beware<WH8104> that there be not a thought<WH1697> in thy wicked<WH1100> heart<WH3824>, saying<WH559>, The seventh<WH7651> year<WH8141>, the year<WH8141> of release<WH8059>, is at hand<WH7126>; and thine eye<WH5869> be evil<WH7489> against thy poor<WH34> brother<WH251>, and thou givest<WH5414> him nought; and he cry<WH7121> unto the LORD<WH3068> against thee, and it be sin<WH2399> unto thee. thought: Heb. word wicked: Heb. Belial

Thou shalt surely<WH5414> give<WH5414> him, and thine heart<WH3824> shall not be grieved<WH3415> when thou givest<WH5414> unto him: because<WH1558> that for this thing<WH1697> the LORD<WH3068> thy God<WH430> shall bless<WH1288> thee in all thy works<WH4639>, and in all that thou puttest<WH4916> thine hand<WH3027> unto.

For the poor<WH34> shall never cease<WH2308> out of<WH7130> the land<WH776>: therefore I command<WH6680> thee, saying<WH559>, Thou shalt open<WH6605> thine hand<WH3027> wide<WH6605> unto thy brother<WH251>, to thy poor<WH6041>, and to thy needy<WH34>, in thy land<WH776>.

And if thy brother<WH251>, an Hebrew man<WH5680>, or an Hebrew woman<WH5680>, be sold<WH4376> unto thee, and serve<WH5647> thee six<WH8337> years<WH8141>; then in the seventh<WH7637> year<WH8141> thou shalt let him go<WH7971> free<WH2670> from thee.
And when thou sendest<WH7971> him out free<WH2670> from thee, thou shalt not let him go away<WH7971> empty<WH7387>:

Thou shalt furnish<WH6059> him liberally<WH6059> out of thy flock<WH6629>, and out of thy floor<WH1637>, and out of thy winepress<WH3342>: of that wherewith the LORD<WH3068> thy God<WH430> hath blessed<WH1288> thee thou shalt give<WH5414> unto him.

And thou shalt remember<WH2142> that thou wast a bondman<WH5650> in the land<WH776> of Egypt<WH4714>, and the LORD<WH3068> thy God<WH430> redeemed<WH6299> thee: therefore I command<WH6680> thee this thing<WH1697> to day<WH3117>.
And it shall be, if he say<WH559> unto thee, I will not go away<WH3318> from thee; because he loveth<WH157> thee and thine house<WH1004>, because he is well<WH2895> with thee;

Then thou shalt take<WH3947> an aul<WH4836>, and thrust<WH5414> it through his ear<WH241> unto the door<WH1817>, and he shall be thy servant<WH5650> for ever<WH5769>. And also unto thy maidservant<WH519> thou shalt do<WH6213> likewise.

It shall not seem hard<WH7185> unto thee<WH5869>, when thou sendest him away<WH7971> free<WH2670> from thee; for he hath been worth<WH7939> a double<WH4932> hired servant<WH7916> to thee, in serving<WH5647> thee six<WH8337> years<WH8141>: and the LORD<WH3068> thy God<WH430> shall bless<WH1288> thee in all that thou doest<WH6213>.

All the firstling<WH1060> males<WH2145> that come<WH3205> of thy herd<WH1241> and of thy flock<WH6629> thou shalt sanctify<WH6942> unto the LORD<WH3068> thy God<WH430>: thou shalt do no work<WH5647> with the firstling<WH1060> of thy bullock<WH7794>, nor shear<WH1494> the firstling<WH1060> of thy sheep<WH6629>.
Thou shalt eat<WH398> it before<WH6440> the LORD<WH3068> thy God<WH430> year<WH8141> by year<WH8141> in the place<WH4725> which the LORD<WH3068> shall choose<WH977>, thou and thy household<WH1004>.

And if there be any blemish<WH3971> therein, as if it be lame<WH6455>, or blind<WH5787>, or have any ill<WH7451> blemish<WH3971>, thou shalt not sacrifice<WH2076> it unto the LORD<WH3068> thy God<WH430>.
Thou shalt eat<WH398> it within thy gates<WH8179>: the unclean<WH2931> and the clean<WH2889> person shall eat it alike<WH3162>, as the roebuck<WH6643>, and as the hart<WH354>.
Only thou shalt not eat<WH398> the blood<WH1818> thereof; thou shalt pour<WH8210> it upon the ground<WH776> as water<WH4325>.
